column1: BLACK001-DN238885-02393674,Contract,"Blackpool Council",Awarded,2017-03-21T16:35:37Z,"Remodelling of the City Learning Centre to provide Shop Units, Library, Offices, Reception, Single Storey extension and the demolition of the Chepstow Road Shops and Maisonette Block.","Blackpool Council has instructed Capital Projects to appoint suitably experienced Building Contractors to carry out the Remodelling of the City Learning Centre to provide Shop Units, Library Offices, Reception, Single Storey Extension and the Demolition of the Chepstow Road Shops and Maisonette Block.

The refurbishment and remodelling works required will need to be undertaken whilst part of the CLC building is occupied and operational. The demolition of the former Shops and Maisonettes will commence when the shop tenants have moved to the CLC.

It is the intention of the Council to prepare the existing and Chepstow sites above for future housing development.",,,"North West","45000000 ","Fraser Cavill",fraser.cavill@blackpool.gov.uk,"PO Box 4",,Blackpool,"FY1 1NA",England,"+44 1253478379",http://www.blackpool.gov.uk/,,,,02/05/2017,02/11/2017,27/02/2017,NO,,No,No,No,Works,1000000,1000000,21/03/2017,884435.2,"[Keepmoat Regeneration Ltd

column1: F0239  - AWARD,Contract,"Birmingham City Council",Awarded,2016-01-19T16:40:44Z,"F0239 Birmingham City Council Contract for the Provision of Responsive Repairs & Maintenance Services, Gas Servicing, Capital Improvement Work Programmes including Major Adaptations to Council Housing Stock in the North, South, West-Central and East areas  - AWARD","Under the Housing Act 1985 and the Landlord and Tenant Act 1985 the Council has statutory obligations to carry out the repairs and maintenance of its housing stock. Therefore, the Contracting Authority - Birmingham City Council (the 'Council') - entered into Competitive Dialogue to appoint service providers to deliver the provision of Responsive Repairs & Maintenance Services, Gas Servicing, Capital Improvement Work Programmes including Major Adaptations to Council House Properties and Garages, in the North, South, West-Central, and East areas of Birmingham.  These areas, known as quadrants account for approximately 63,322 properties (excluding garages, communal areas, managed and leaseholder properties but includes 	1,103 TMO’s). Under this procurement, the Council was seeking to appoint a minimum of two and a maximum of four contractors to cover the four quadrant areas to carry out the above services.  It was not permissible for contractors to be awarded contract areas totalling more than 34,000 properties.
The transfer of staff will take place by operation of the Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations 2006 (“TUPE”).

The contracts were procured using the Competitive Dialogue Procedure and will be for an initial term of four years, with the option to extend for up to two periods of two years each, subject to satisfactory performance and negotiation of satisfactory commercial terms.

These contracts do not commit or offer any guarantee to the level of expenditure, changes in the volume of job categories or the volume or mix of work included in the Competitive Dialogue suite of document.

There was a mandatory requirement for all successful contractors to adopt and become signatories to all the principles contained in the Birmingham Business Charter for Social Responsibility. (BBC4SR).

column1: COB-P189 - AWARD,Contract,"Symphony Housing Group",Awarded,2015-10-26T13:31:11Z,"Cobalt - Window renewal programme 2015-17 - AWARD","Cobalt is seeking to enter into a contract with a suitably qualified contractor to install windows:-

Lot 1: 6,989 windows to 905 number of homes (769 houses, 21 Bungalows and 115 low rise flats) in Norris Green, Fazakerley & Croxteth areas of Liverpool. Full surveyed data is available with start on site anticipated October 2015 and practical completion November 2016. The anticipated contract value is between £1.7m and £1.9m Achieving the start on site and practical completion dates are critical and Contractors are required to demonstrate how they will meet and manage this challenging programme. For tender documentation please click below.
Lot 2: A Framework of the 5 highest rank contractors from lot 1 to undertake future window renewals. Mini-competitions to be carried out for packages of properties. No defined contract value.

column1: MT179670,Contract,"Family Mosaic",Awarded,2016-08-22T16:45:08Z,"Contractors Framework","Family Mosaic has an ongoing programme of new housing developments throughout London and Essex, and has grant funded programmes with both the GLA and HCA to develop Affordable Housing as part of their 2015/18 Affordable Housing Programmes, the scope of this framework will cover geographically the areas of Greater London and Essex.

Family Mosaic as a group is looking to develop approximately 1,000 new homes per year, across all tenures to reflect Government changing priorities, whilst maintaining a programme of affordable rent by generating cross subsidy through developing shared ownership, private sale and market rent new homes. The proportion of each tenure will dependent on each site and location.

In addition to the above Family Mosaic as Lead Registered Provider will on occasions provide development services to other RPs as part of its funding agreements with the GLA and HCA, together with other separate legal entities formed for specific projects or programmes (these companies are either whole owned or partially owned by a member of the Family Mosaic Group).

Family Mosaic's new works construction programme over the four years duration of this framework is estimated to be in the region of 740 million GBP, with 30% of this delivered by S106s, leaving a balance of 518 million GBP pounds of directly instructed construction works. In addition to the Family Mosaic's programme this framework is being procured on behalf of other Registered Providers and Local Authorities who may wish to develop within London (the GLA area) and Essex, and who wish to sign up to Family Mosaic Framework. This will enable framework suppliers to access an additional volume of work and reduce their pre-qualification costs. At present there is no other RPs or LAs signed up, but to allow scope for this possibility the value of this framework construction costs are estimated not to exceed 600 million GBP.

Family Mosaic Housing wishes to establish a Framework Agreement for Contractor Services with contractors who can deliver on this varied programme together with supplying these services to other Registered Providers and Local Authorities who register to use this Framework for the purposes detailed above in the geographical area of Greater London and Essex.

The scope of this framework is principally to cover new mixed tenure residential developments above the EU procurement threshold, with a majority of the contracts in the range of 5 million GBP to 15 million GBP. For contracts below threshold Family Mosaic may opt to procure from SMEs and for exceptionally large contracts, regeneration projects choose to separately advertise these opportunities as part of an OJEU process. To ensure that Contractors who are appointed to the framework have sufficient financial capacity to carry out contracts on this framework a minimum annual turnover requirement has been set of 18 million GBP (see PQQ).",,,"East of England,London","45210000 45111000 45000000 45211200 45211000 45211100 45211300 45211341 45211340 45200000 ","Cora Marler",cora.marler@sweettgroup.com,"Albion House","20 Queen Elizabeth Street",London,"SE1 2RJ","

column1: INTEXTWOR2016,Contract,"WESTWORKS PROCUREMENT LIMITED",Awarded,2016-05-18T10:17:42Z,"Internal & External Works 2016","Initial expressions of interest are invited from potential providers wishing to provide planned, cyclical and ad hoc external works services to occupied & vacant domestic housing & commercial properties throughout the area covered by Westworks, its members and partners. Providers appointed to the framework may be required to act as main contractor within projects and to utilise supply chains already or yet to be established by Westworks. Similarly providers may be required to act as a supply partner to users partnerships. These occurrences will be clearly indicated to potential providers at the time of contract call off by users and will be incorporated as part of the mini competition process.

The geographical area to be covered by this framework covers the South and South west of England. For an approximate distribution of the volume of works required please review the information in the suite of download documents.

We are therefore inviting variant bids based on GEOGRAPHICAL capability so as to encourage small to medium and larger enterprises to participate. Companies should make clear the areas within which they can presently deliver the services required. Limited geographical coverage by a potential provider will not necessarily exclude them from the process as it is Westworks members aim to encourage local employment and businesses as well as engaging with other suitably qualified providers. It is the intention of Westworks to engage with enough suitably qualified providers to achieve these aims.
The TOTAL estimated value is between £1 million to £850 million over the entire 4 year life of the framework.
The framework will be of 13 work stream lots and multiple providers will be considered to achieve geographical and volume coverage for each lot:
13. Cavity Wall Insulation Cleaning and Reinstatement

It is not the intention to split the works by geographical lots but to award places on the framework based on having enough providers to deliver in all areas and to award works contracts by running mini-competitions (mini-tenders) from the framework. Bidders will be required to identify the areas in which they are able to provide the services described within the tender documents.",,,"Any region,East Midlands,West Midlands,London,South East,South West,Wales","92522000 45000000 ","Susana Almeida",info@westworks.org.uk,"The National Self Build & Renovation Centre, Lydiard Fields,","Great Western Way",Swindon,"SN5 8UB",England,,www.westworks.org.uk,,,,09/09/2016,08/09/2020,05/07/2016,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Works,1000000,850000000,08/11/2016,1000000,"[24-7 Home Serve Ltd

MT173190,Contract,"Fusion 21 Limited",Awarded,2016-03-31T11:13:41Z,"Installation Works","The Installation Works Framework provides a procurement solution for the installation of materials on planned maintenance programmes for Kitchens, Bathrooms and Windows and Doors. The Framework is split in to 4 main Lots to cover these work streams. To allow for SME bidding opportunities, Lots 1 to 3 are broken down in to 2 sub-lots / value bands. The Lotting Structure is identified as follows:
LOT 1 - Kitchen Installations (1a - Contracts Up to GBP450k, and 1b - Contracts Over 450k).
LOT 2 - Bathroom Installations (2a - Contracts Up to GBP300k, and 2b - Contracts Over 300k).
LOT 3 - Windows and Doors Installations (3a - Contracts Up To GBP200k, and 3b - Contracts Over 200k).
LOT 4 - Communal Door Installations (no value bands).

The main coverage of work required under this Framework will be for installation as supply of materials is covered under a separate Fusion21 procurement exercise for Kitchens, Bathrooms and Windows and Doors. There will be scope however, dependent on individual client requirements, for a supply and install option to be included under this Framework which will be undertaken in the form of a mini competition between Framework partners.",,,"Scotland,North East,Yorkshire and the Humber,North West,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,South East,South West,Wales,Northern Ireland,Any region,London","45300000 39141400 45421151 45211310 45421130 45421100 44221000 39144000 ","Nick Verburg",info@fusion21.co.uk,"Link Road Depot","Link Road Huyton",Liverpool,"L36 6AP","

column1: BIP415361999,Contract,"ForViva Group Limited",Awarded,2019-07-22T13:40:10Z,"Development Framework Agreement","ForViva is procuring a Framework Agreement pursuant to which it is envisaged that contracts will be let to contractors within the Framework for the provision of a range of new build construction and development projects (""Development Contracts"").
The Framework Agreement will be divided into 3 Lots;
Lot 1- Contractors - Call-off Contract value of less than £2 million
Lot 2 - Contractors - Call-off Contract value of between £2 million and £5 million.
Lot 3 - Contractors - Call-off Contract value of more than £5 million.

A summary of the types of contracts / projects that will be called off under each of them and the total estimated value of these over the four year Framework term is set out in the tender documentation.",,,"Any region","45211000 ",,tenders@citywest.org.uk,"52 Regent Street",,Eccles,"M30 0BP",UK,+441616057606,,,"https://www.delta-esourcing.com/delta/respondToList.html?noticeId=415361999 ",,01/04/2018,31/03/2020,08/10/2017,NO,,No,No,No,Works,43000000,,08/10/2017,43000000,"[Lovell Partnerships Limited

column1: DN232184/2,Contract,"BERNESLAI HOMES LIMITED",Awarded,2017-05-05T09:51:41Z,"ELECTRICAL INSTALLATION FRAMEWORK","Berneslai Homes is seeking to appoint suitably experienced organisations to be included on a electrical installation framework.
This includes the supply of all labour, plant and materials to carry out and complete electrical installation works to council dwellings.
The works may include any of the following:
•	Works as part of adaptation works to properties.
•	Works in connection with heating installations.
•	Works in connection with programmed replacements and planned repairs.
All tenders must be submitted via the YORtender system by Thursday 16th February 2017 at 16:30 hrs. www.yortender.co.uk
If you are not already registered as a supplier on YORtender you must register and you will then be able to express an interest in the procurement to gain access to the tender documents.

Any queries regarding this tender must be submitted via the messaging area of YORtender. Communication will not be accepted by any other means.",,,"Yorkshire and the Humber","45310000 50000000 51000000 ",,procurementreferences@berneslaihomes.co.uk,"Berneslai Homes, Construction Services","Unit 2, Industry Road, Carlton",Barnsley,"S71 3PQ",England,,www.yortender.co.uk,,,,05/05/2017,04/05/2021,16/02/2017,YES,DN232184,Yes,No,No,Works,0,3000000,18/04/2017,0,"[SSE ENTERPRISE CONTRACTING LTD

2017/S 075-144433,Contract,"NEWLON HOUSING TRUST",Awarded,2017-04-18T16:42:12Z,"Construction Framework Agreement","This is a contract award notice following an OJEU procurement by Newlon Housing Trust to appoint suitably qualified and experienced suppliers to enter into a framework agreement for the delivery of construction / design and construction works to facilitate our programme of building new homes. Newlon Housing Trust has an affordable Housing Growth Target of 2000 dwellings to be constructed by the year 2022. It is estimated that contracts with a total value of 50 000 000 GBP - 200 000 000 GBP will be let within the term of the Framework. The value of works contracts to be awarded through this Framework has been based on limited knowledge of expected and potential schemes and projects.

The framework has been awarded in 3 lots which are Lot 1 Works contract value 2 500 000 GBP - 10 000 000 GBP, Lot 2 Works contract value 10 000 000 GBP - 25 000 000 GBP, Lot 3 Works contract value 25 000 000 GBP +. Suppliers have been appointed by Lot and the full breakdown can be seen by opening the attached OJEU contract award notice 2017/S 075-144433. The value of contracts has been based on limited knowledge of potential projects. These have not yet been planned to a detailed level, therefore identifying how these contracts will be split across the Lots is not possible at this time.
The contract will be available for use by:
(ii) registered providers and local authorities owning and/or managing stock in areas where members of the Newlon group own and/or manage stock; and
(iii) other registered providers and local authorities in the UK.
The value of opportunities with other organisations under the contract is not known.

Newlon Housing Trust reserves the right not to award any contract pursuant to this procurement exercise and/or to abandon this procurement exercise at any time and/or to award a contract for part of the services only, at its sole discretion. Newlon Housing shall have no liability whatsoever to any applicant as a result of its exercise of this discretion.",,,London,"45000000 ","Imran Yasin",Imran.Yasin@newlon.org.uk,"Newlon House",,London,"N17 9FE",England,02076137591,,"2017-OJS075-144433-en.pdf ",,,04/04/2017,03/04/2021,24/10/2016,NO,,No,No,No,Works,0,,04/04/2017,0,"[Bugler Developments
T/11419,Contract,"LONDON & QUADRANT HOUSING TRUST LIMITED",Awarded,2017-07-25T15:49:48Z,"Internal Refurbishment Programme 2017-2021","The anticipated works include:
the replacement of kitchens, bathrooms and associated electrical works;
minor and major aids and adaptions (A and As) work for residents with reduced mobility;
asbestos management; asbestos surveys via Service Provider's UKAS accredited consultant; asbestos removal works to be carried out by Service Provider's Licenced Asbestos Removal Service Provider;

role of Principal Designer (PD) under CDM Regulations 2015 at point of contract award.",,,"London,South East","45453000 ",,Procurement@lqgroup.org.uk,"Kings Hall Mews",Lewisham,London,"SE13 5JQ",England,,,,,,27/06/2017,31/03/2018,13/03/2017,NO,,Yes,No,No,Works,34100000,,16/06/2017,34100000,"[Wates Construction Ltd
